description.narrative: Agroforestal Uumbal Veracruz (Veracruz or the Company) is a pine forestry company established in 2011 as a JV between Industrias AlEn (AlEn), a leading Mexican household cleaning products company, and Ecom Agroindustrial (ECOM), a global agribusiness company. The Company was created to produce pine resin for the manufacturing of household cleaning products. From planting, trees take about 7 years to reach a meaningful resin production. The project will support the sustainable forestry operations to bring the plantation to its productive plateau.

The Project is expected to contribute to job creation and linkages with farmers in an under-developed part of the country as well as substantive GHG emission reductions and support for positive environmental effects. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will stem from enhanced integration of the market through by establishing a competitive and sustainable commercial operation that would serve as proof of concept for other market participants.
